alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; North Snowy Range Foothills; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued February 13 at 2:43AM MST until February 14 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE THIS EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...West to northwest winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 65 MPH. * WHERE...The northern Snowy Range Foothills, The Interstate 80 Summit and adjacent foothills, and southwest Platte County and the central Laramie Range. * WHEN...Late This evening through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight or high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Although winds will subside Tuesday evening, some blowing snow is possible due to gusts of 40 to 50 MPH and developing snowfall.
info.instruction: A High Wind Watch means there is the potential for a hazardous high wind event. Sustained winds of at least 40 mph, or gusts of 58 mph or stronger may occur. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; North Snowy Range Foothills; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
